questions.question: How do you know if a phrase is a metaphor?

choices.answer: It uses “like” or “as” to compare things.
It compares by saying something is something else.
It makes something that is not human seem human.
It contains a person, place, or thing.

imageMetadata.resources: Photo by AD Studio on Unsplash

questions.resources: Photo by AD Studio on Unsplash

questions.question: How do you know if a phrase is a simile?

choices.answer: It uses “like” or “as” to compare things.
It compares by saying something is something else.
It makes something that is not human seem human.
It contains a person, place, or thing.

imageMetadata.resources: Photo by rohro clark on Unsplash

questions.resources: Photo by rohro clark on Unsplash

questions.question: "As angry as a hornet." Simile or metaphor?

choices.answer: Simile.
Metaphor.

imageMetadata.resources: Photo by Birgit Lengert on Unsplash

questions.resources: Photo by Birgit Lengert on Unsplash

questions.question: Explain this metaphor: You are my sunshine.

choices.answer: You are a star in the sky.
You are hot and bright.
You are special to me.
You are wearing yellow.

questions.question: Explain this metaphor: Marco thinks he is the class clown.

choices.answer: Marco is interrupting class with jokes.
Marco is wearing make up and a red nose.
Marco juggle and does tricks in class.
Marco works for a circus.

questions.question: Explain this simile: Those two friends are like peas in a pod.

choices.answer: They are small, green veggies.
They are dressed in a pea costume.
They are in a green case.
They are very similar.

imageMetadata.resources: Photo by Jan Kolar on Unsplash

questions.resources: Photo by Jan Kolar on Unsplash

questions.question: She is feeling blue today. Simile or metaphor?

choices.answer: Simile.
Metaphor.

imageMetadata.resources: Photo by Samuel Scrimshaw on Unsplash

questions.resources: Photo by Samuel Scrimshaw on Unsplash

questions.question: Your heart is as cold as ice. Simile or Metaphor?

choices.answer: Simile.
Metaphor.

imageMetadata.resources: Photo by Bryan Rodriquez on Unsplash

questions.resources: Photo by Bryan Rodriquez on Unsplash

questions.question: Complete this simile: He walked as slow as a ________.

choices.answer: person
cheetah
snail
car

imageMetadata.resources: Photo by Yuliya Kosolapova on Unsplash

questions.resources: Photo by Yuliya Kosolapova on Unsplash

questions.question: Why do authors use similes and metaphors?

choices.answer: To confuse the reader.
To be funny.
To help the reader imagine the scene.
To make the story longer and use many words.

imageMetadata.resources: Photo by Louis Maniquet on Unsplash

questions.resources: Photo by Louis Maniquet on Unsplash
